results.title: The City and the self
results.brief_description: Presents a study of human relations in the city based on psychological concepts formulated by Professor Stanley Milgram. Examines the city dwellers’ perception of their city and their behavior in created situations.

results.title: The City
results.creator_credit: Falph Steiner, Willard Van Dyke and American Documentary Films
results.brief_description: An indictment of unplanned city growth and uncontrolled expansion of industry, this is one of America’s best documentary films, famous for its “eating sequence”. The film has three distinct sections: first, the early pastoral life of the American colonies; the chaotic and industrialised metropolis, the sprawling contrasting city, the dirt, poverty, ill health and despair of the victims of the industrial city’s haphazard growth; the necessity for planned city growth. Based on Lewis Mumford’s book, “The Culture of Cities”, this film owes much of its punch to the editing of well-chosen details, excellently photographed, enabling the film to argue visually.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Falph Steiner, Willard Van Dyke and American Documentary Films

results.title: Democracy in action: citizen's welfare, citizen's job
results.creator_credit: H Schiller, O.E. Kress and Ifage Filmproduktion (DE)
results.brief_description: A close look at the manifold tasks of the elected shire and town councillors in Germany. We see them at meetings, seeking progress and prosperity for their citizens. By encouraging and helping establish new local industries on a community basis, there is resultant increase in population, housing, hospitals, and amenities. Such progress is soundly based and assured.
results.title_for_label: Democracy in action: citizen’s welfare, citizen’s job
results.creator_credit_for_label: H Schiller, O.E. Kress and Ifage Filmproduktion (DE)

results.title: Citizens in uniform
results.brief_description: The soldier of the Bundeswehr has to submit to a hard training suitable to meet the requirements of a technical age. He also has rights which underline his equal position as a citizen. As a member of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, the German Republic must contribute its share against the Communist threat.

results.title: A Citizen of Singapore
results.creator_credit: Brian Salt, Gaumont-British Instructional and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: Through the story of a seven-year-old, Hung Swee Kiat, the film outlines the scope and progress of Singapore’s Ten Year Development Scheme to provide free education for all children, regardless of race and creed. The film closes with official ceremonies at a youth rally which concluded Education Week, during which exhibitions and displays brought the Scheme to the notice of the public.

results.title: Citizen Harold
results.creator_credit: Hugh Foulds, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated satire about one man’s attempt to bring changes in his community through participation with fellow citizens and the local government. A discussion starter with a dual ending, for groups exploring methods of bringing about change. (Awards: New York, Melbourne, Columbus.)

results.title: Citizen army
results.brief_description: The Citizen Military Forces form an important part of Australia’s defence program. This film shows the men of the CMF, citizens in uniform, in a mock assault on an objective during training.

results.title: Cities in crisis: what's happening?
results.creator_credit: Ray Witlin and Universal City Studios Productions
results.brief_description: The first in a series dealing with environmental pollution. this film juxtaposes scenes of congestion, pollution, and decay which are the results of uncontrolled growth, inadequate planning and insufficient concern in a sprawling metropolitan city. Exposes the social, economic and moral values that have permitted the megalopolis to arise. No spoken commentary.

results.title: Cities in crisis II: a matter of survival
results.creator_credit: Ray Witlin and Universal Education and Visual Arts
results.brief_description: Alarming levels of pollution parallel with urban and industrial growth are being recorded in the metropolitan areas of the United States. Land, air, water and the human ear are victims of this pollution. This film contrasts scenes of rural beauty accompanied by readings from Walt Whitman with the rising accumulations of refuse and decay that threaten the nation’s health.

results.title: Circus in Europe
results.brief_description: The arrival of a small circus in a European town, and the parade through the streets. Some of the circus acts are shown, including animal acts and acrobatics. No commentary except for some brief words in German by the circus ringmaster.
